etymologies: early 17th century. From French marotte object of a ridiculous and exaggerated affection, foolish idea, jester's baton bearing a head with multicoloured belled cap, image of the Virgin Mary from Marie, the name of the Virgin Mary + -ot

definitions: A baton carried by a fool or jester as a mock emblem of office; = "bauble".

notes.text: "†to crown with a marotte": to make a fool of (obsolete).
